full_text:
Re: Defense private investigator/permission to visit mcc
From
To
Date 2019/12/06 08:50
Subject: Re: Defense private investigator/permission to visit mcc
Attachments: TEXT.htm, Mime.822

Good morning. I am following up to see if we can expect that
will be cleared to visit on Monday. If not, we will need to seek a court order since his travel has already been set my the court and the CJA office. Thank you.

Sent from my iPhone

On Dec 5, 2019, at 3:36 PM,
@gmail.com> wrote:

Hello again.
I am attaching the Sponsoring Attorney form with
signature instead of an electronic signature.
Please let us know if you need anything else from us. Thank you.
Esq.
EPSTEIN SACHS PLLC
Office: 212.684.
Mobile: 917.566.

CONFIDENTIALITY: This email communication and any files transmitted with it may contain privileged and confidential information and are intended solely for the use of the individuals or entity to whom it has been addressed. If you have received this email in error, please delete it and notify the sender by return email.

On Thu, Dec 5, 2019 at 3:03 PM
@gmail.com> wrote:

Attached please find the BOP visitation form and licensing credentials from the private investigator.
Please let me know what else you need from us. We recently received CJA permission for
to travel to NYC to visit our client with us at the MCC on Monday and Tuesday next week, so I appreciate your helping us to expedite this process.
Best,
EPSTEIN SACHS PLLC
Office: 212.684
Mobile: 917.566

CONFIDENTIALITY: This email communication and any files transmitted with it may contain privileged and confidential information and are intended solely for the use of the individuals or entity to whom it has been addressed. If you have received this email in error, please delete it and notify the sender by return email.
